DOCNAME: CASE OF ZJEDNOCZONE BROWARY WARSZAWSKIE HABERBUSCH I SCHIELE S.A. v. POLAND
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a join - stock company with its registered seat in ORG .

CARDINAL . By way of an administrative decision of CARDINAL DATE a property owned by the applicant and located in GPE was expropriated pursuant to provisions of the DATE PERSON on transfer to the ORG of the ownership of the main branches of the national economy ( LOC z DATE r. o przejęciu na wlasność GPE podstawowych gałęzi gospodarki narodowej ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG an application to have the expropriation decision declared null and void . The proceedings were subsequently conducted before PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Finance gave a decision and refused to declare the expropriation decision null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer requested the Minister of Finance to re - examine the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Finance upheld his own decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed both decisions of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Finance gave a decision and stayed the proceedings finding that the examination of the case was dependent on the establishment of the components of the applicant 's enterprise ( ustalenie składników przedsiębiorstwa skarżącego ) , which fell within the competence of the Minister of Agriculture . On DATE the Minister of Finance requested the Minister of Agriculture to resolve the preliminary issue ( zagadnienie wstępne ) referred to above . Since then , the proceedings have been pending before the Minister of Finance .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed against the decision to stay the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Finance upheld the challenged decision . Since that date the proceedings have been stayed before the Minister of Finance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture gave a decision and stayed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The applicant requested a re - examination of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture upheld his decision .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the complaint well - founded and quashed both decisions of the Minister of Agriculture .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE the Minister of Agriculture gave a decision and discontinued the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The applicant again requested a re - examination of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture upheld his decision .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed both decisions of the Minister of Agriculture .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are pending before the Minister of Agriculture .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant lodged a complaint about the inactivity on the part of the Minister of Agriculture .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the complaint well - founded and ordered that the Minister of Agriculture give a decision on the preliminary issue within DATE of the court 's judgment .
CARDINAL . NORP The Minister failed to comply with the court 's order and therefore , on DATE , the applicant requested ORG to impose a fine on him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint finding that on DATE the Minister had given a decision and stayed the relevant proceedings . Therefore , although he did not give a decision on the merits , it could not be said that the Minister was completely inactive .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG , which was dismissed on DATE .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant again complained to ORG about the inactivity on the part of LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as being pointless finding that , on DATE , the Minister of Agriculture had given a decision and upheld his own decision to stay the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law on remedies for inaction on the part of the administrative authorities is set out in the ORG 's judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .
